twitch_info.title: Highlight: 259+ Hours of Enhanced Interrogation Techniques

message.body: hi xoryla, glad to see you!
I feel like this attack might not be fair
today i finally learned the pattern in gureiga stage
basically started a fun part of grind
but im glad i got out from this routine
feeling like will clear it in couple of days
it's supposed to be easier than afoth stage
yeah, things are going well on my end
not really looking forward to attempts, but oh well
the thing is that gureiga stage is a bit higher than afoth in hof sheet
interesting, max may have changed his mind at some point
I could've sworn he had it as being easier at one point
well, afoth grind time totally depends on your pattern learning skill
i have vad relationships with patterns in fangames
so that's why dijivunda cleared it so quickly LUL
and gureiga is filled with rng
except, well, that god damn pattern
I'm sure you will miss the pattern when you get to tomo stage Kappa
Meaning, you will wish that you were doing gureiga pattern instead of bullshit tomo rng
let me find the dictionary definition
yeah, forgetting stuff is a given
just like forgetting pattern in melanzana or something
even on 0.9x speed I cannot dodge final
for the position you were standing there
the thing is, that happens a lot
I feel like the fact that final is luck makes this avoidance so much harder
since getting to the end once is just not enough to clear, most of the time
feeling like 1.0 grind is unbelievably close
it's like you need to beat the game multiple times before it admits you've won
yeah, I could probably switch to 1.0 practice in the next few days
yeah, well, the game spared me
yeah, anyone who first-tries final saves a boatload of time
i don't know if anyone would ever get that free final attack as mine
I think final gives free rng maybe 10% of the time
I will stand in the corner and do nothing, and we will see how many times I beat it
I think I got somewhat lucky
yes, if you move it's way more than 10%
that's why moving to the corner and walking away from the keyboard is a bad idea
I am pretty bad at final, even accounting for rng
but it's so luckbased I just want to get lucky
who can be good at this attack
even casualcrap died to it 8 times before he cleared
and he's the best barrage player on the planet
yes, he says that in his clear video
the problem is that you're too slow and your hitbox is too big
this game would be not so impressive if kid there had smaller hitbox
yes, it would have to be buffed
and if kid had smaller hitbox
you wouldn't probably play this game

the thing is, most of the attacks are very bullshit. sometimes they are free, and sometimes they are impossible/very hard. So to make the attacks fair by changing the hitbox, you'd necessarily have to make the hitbox so small that the attacks become too easy
yeah, If this game was dot hitbox or something I would not play it
if it were like charisma breaker, for instance
overall I think the game is good, and I'm happy with it, but it's definitely not free of issues
destruction state is forever in my heart
no matter what avoidance i play
i will always remember this exact one
when I beat it I'm sure it will be the same for me
you know i have a feeling that after 100% i will go for MayumushiPls
i feel like it is a... good idea?
If I were more interested in pattern I'd do it
but the pattern is scaring me off
also, casualcrap skipped mayumushi and went straight for last tis
i just know some of my friends had learned mayu patterns to the point when they can literally always firsttry them
and they don't have much experience to clear it
wait, they're saying they could clear without taking much time?
so i think that if i pass that terrible pattern learning part of grind
like i did in gureiga today
i will probably go for clearing it because i feel like reading rng
they're saying that they can firsttry every pattern of the avoidance
but everyone knows that the problem of the avoidance is mostly rng parts
(they have practice tool so they learned it to that point)
I wonder how hard the rng really is
another reason I do not want to play it is that I think a lot of the difficulty must come from the length
because of my english sentence forming
but I like attacks that are just hard
I am an english professional Keepo
what would you play after mayumushi?
yeah, I beat the game a few times from this checkpoint
I will switch to 1.0 speed after this lecture is over
i can't see that far future algo Kappa
what would i play after mayu
the only thing I'd consider doing is 0.95
anything else is just so slow you'd hardly notice
I might try that with the next game I play then
just inch the speed up 1 fps at a time
that game will be insane so I will need good practice ideas
it's okay, we can still hear you die
this is the real first attempt
wow you're totally blowing it lorema2Goat
the nerve of JR to say that I had the "same problems" as him in games
I'm surprised he wasn't banned Keepo
in Bioshock he'd throw a grenade at a guy, then run up to melee the enemy and get blow up by his own grenade
oh so that's a friend of yours
JR is a friend of ours who started to play Dark Souls 1 and we all got together and asked him to stop
because he was failing so hard we worried it would cause permanent psychological trauma
yeah, so when jr said that nojah has the same problems as him, it was the ultimate insult Kappa
right now I'm learning Thai vowels
I remember it took me like two weeks to learn kana
and it was not that great
and there's a fair number of lookalike kana
but Thai is really bad about lookalike letters
@LoremasterNojah yeah, it was a good pace. I still get some similar stuff confused
and the tiny-ass font they use NotLikeThis
ค ฅ ด ต
so there are minimal pairs involving those letters and you'd confuse them?
actually I got that backwards, it's [ch] and [s]
ช ช ช ช ช ช ช ช
depends on which character that is
ok, then I am indeed a snake
nah I messed up, it's ch
each letter has a word that it's used in
was it a jesuit or something?
nah it's based on other South Asian abugidas
hopefully all those languages went extinct
all the Southeast Asian scripts are based on Sanskrit stuff
nah Thai, Lao, Khmer, Burmese all use systems like this
សេរីភាពនិងភាពស្មើៗគ្នាក្នុងសិទ្ធិ និងសេចក្ដីថ្លៃថ្នូរ ។ មនុស្សគ្រប់រូបសុទ្ធតែមានវិចារណញ្ញា
the word after the first space
I can kind of see it
but it's pretty different as well
यांमार लिपि या बर्मी लिपि sanskrit?
that's the modern version of the writing system used to write Sanskrit
it's a system that's undergone a lot of evolution and branching
nearly all the modern Hindustani and Dravidian languages use some variant
except where they adopted Arabic-based scripts in Pakistan etc
do you have an resources for thai vocab?
I'll just look shit up as I play
thai probably doesn't have anything as good as jisho
once you get past the initial hurdle of the script, it's not that hard
the tonal system is complicated but who cares
but youll get better when you get used to 1.0
also, when I am not sleep deprived
it gives you tunnel vision and makes it impossible to make good reads
i am in that state rn
I am not sure what I will do for attempts
I would not do attempts in this kind of state
but I do want to stream my attempts to people can see the clear live
it would be no fair to people who watch the practice for me to clear offstream
id be glad just to see your clear
no matter if it happened offstream or not
I will be happy to share it with you and everyone else
ok ive become really sleepy for some reason
feeling like ill go to bed earlier than usual
I'll probably call it here anyways
